Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <hellcatz - LuckPool> @dukeleto I think you would require a rescan in the situation of orphaned tx...if the tx didn't get rebroadcast into the next block because of conflicts. I had something like this happen before for another reason...rescanning was only way to sort out the issue and get funds back so I could try to spend again...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @hellcatz - LuckPool very interesting, thanks for that data point

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh to be able to send and receive encrypted memos on a mobile phone, instead of on a desktop computer, which run different operating systems

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh enabling wifi on your phone doesn't allow you to send+receive zxtns from your phone

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh and a wormhole service is a backend server that acts as proxy to allow your desktop computer pair to your phone, even if they can't directly access each other directly (because of firewalls usually or lack of public ip+port)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> uses websockets

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> WS = WebSocket = WormholeService

Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> brushing up on my DOS and Sybil Attacks. Came across this elegant attack https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XiFkyR35v2Y

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> ```A slow HTTP DoS attack takes advantage of this by never sending a finishing blank line to complete the HTTP header. While some thread-based servers such as Apache use a timeout when they wait for incomplete HTTP requests, it is set to 300 seconds by default and reset as soon as the client sends the rest of the data```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> so Slow Loris sends a packet every 299 secs or whatever just to keep the thread-based server hanging on

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> is it possible to store Data in the Blockchain like: Name,Address, grade... and share this (maybe via keys) to other teachers or my students?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> There is no app out there here in germany that fits for data protection regulation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Its a big problem since i dont want to work with paper...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Its not even allowed to communicate with my students via email, and so on. Well atm we do it without permission to do so...but maybe Hush technologie can fix this?!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio yes, just use the memo field. Each of your students would have a zaddr, and it would probably fit all data privacy laws

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and a different way to do it, is every student could import your zaddr and "listen" to your broadcasts to them, i.e. HushList

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> I will try it with my students üëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Someone off you should code a app and sell it to teachers, profs and so on üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> That would be very cool

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio each student would have SilentDragon, create a zaddr, give to you, then you send whatever details you want, to each student. It could all work right now (if we had good binaries now, we  don't) but the UI could be improved greatly. Things will be easier with SilentDragonAndroid, then students could setup the desktop SD once, then use an android mobile phone to send + receive memos

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and yes, you could even make your own KMD smart chain for this

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so all your data is isolated even more, or use Hush for now, whatever fits the requirements

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> For now (its just an experiment) i will do it with hush. I just will make zs addresses with a few Hush on it (so they can respond)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Most schools, universities and all societies who have to share private data has this problem in europe atm

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> there aren't any kind of sub-addresses in ZEC/KMD forks right? Are there vanity addresses for zaddrs?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gigamesh> actually HushList has a contact db iirc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Is (will) it be possible to create a database (on Blokchain) and give others access to it (maybe just on parts of data)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Its not possible to change data in the blockchain i guess...or?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio fyi, fee=0 xtns will work on Hush, but the full node won't let you send xtns for amount=0+fee=0 unless you have a non-zero balance in the wallet. Maybe I should change that, but I h aven't

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio yes, you can give out a "viewkey" for a `zs1` address, and that gives somebody else the ability to see all transactions TO it, but not FROM it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and no ability to spend coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is what powers the backend of "HushLists", where you subscribe to somebody elses zaddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> think of it as an RSS feed, powered by an encrypted data field in a blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Can i ‚Äûburn‚Äú this viewkey so that i can withdraw the permission to watch data?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Share personal data of students with my teacher collegs->give them viewkeys-> teacher change->‚Äúburn‚Äú this viewkey so he/she cant access anymore

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @denio best way is to use 1 viewkey for 1 purpose, and when done, never use it again. Sharing a viewkey is kind of like "burning" your right to privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> since somebody else can leak your viewkey to anybody

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> never using it again is best policy. Our GUI wallets need betters ways to track addresses that should not be re-used

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> So its better to use it just to communicate for my usecase

Author: Gateway#3763
